head.supplied: Bot Garden ¶ 21/6/70. ¶ ¶ From the enclosed ¶ you will see, dear Mr Agg, that the papers concerning the gravelling &c at Toorack, and required for adjustment are still in the Lands Office. Pray let ...

div.p: Q68/18477, unit 631, VPRS 44/P inward registered and unregistered correspondence, VA 538 Department of Crown Lands and Survey, Public Record Office, Victoria.
See also E. Agg to M, 31 March 1869. Bot Garden

From the enclosed
MS memorandum: 'Improvements at Toorak in 1867. All papers relating thereto sent to the office of the Hon. the Chief Secretary 29 June 1868 from Botanic Garden'. The papers were referred to the Lands Department on 18 August 1868 'To provide for a/c'. you will see, dear Mr Agg, that the papers concerning the gravelling &c at Toorack, and required for adjustment are still in the Lands Office. Pray let me have them as soon as you can.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Ferd. von Mueller.
Agg minuted 22 June 1870: 'I discovered the papers in the Registry Branch this morning & forward them at once to you — Please return correspondence to this office after you have detached the vouchers'.
